page.title: 12TRADITIONAL USES OF STRAW
page.content: With the decrease in livestock production and the increase in the growth of cereals, the production of straw has far outstripped its traditional uses. {1. Animal Feed_}Straw has minimal food value unless treated with chemicals or molasses but a lot of experimental work is being done on this at the moment. Straw is fed as a roughage. {2. Animal Bedding_}The increasing costs of hauling straw long distances has made farmers look for other methods of bedding stock. {3. Fuel_}Straw is potentially a very useful source of fuel. Several thousand boilers are in use in the UK at the moment, using either bales of straw or brickettes. {4. Building Materials_}Some processes have been developed for turning straw into a variety of compressed boards.
